title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 30 April 2013 - XWiki
content:

00:42 <webczat> Hello. Who can edit programmer pages?  
00:56 <webczat> has quit

10:33 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:39 <sburjan> has quit  
10:47 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:54 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
11:12 <vmassol> good morning  
11:12 <vmassol> tmortagne/mflorea: who's doing the final 5.0 release btw? :)  
11:14 <tmortagne> has quit  
11:19 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
11:20 <mflorea> vmassol: I can do it today, but we need to decide if the issues reported by sburjan and msmeria are blockers. There are two problems I could reproduce: (1) document translation bundle is not registered after upgrade in workspaces and (2) there is a merge problem with the workspace home page title  
11:21 <vmassol> mflorea: look pretty serious no?  
11:21 <vmassol> if you can reproduce then it should be relatively easy to fix  
11:21 <vmassol> so I'd say you should spend the day with thomas to work on them  
11:21 <vmassol> WDYT?  
11:22 <vmassol> tmortagne: what's your take?  
11:22 <mflorea> I'll let thomas says if they are easy to fix or not  
11:22 <sburjan> so DW Upgrade mode has been fixed .. 1) from my e-mail  
11:23 <mflorea> note that I won't be available in the next couple of days, so I can only do the release today..  
11:23 <tmortagne> no idea if (2) would be easy to fix, need to debug it in a diff module unit test  
11:24 <mflorea> tmortagne: I can help you with that by reproducing the problem with a script  
11:24 <tmortagne> as for (1) I don't know what is the issue yet and reproduce it by doing an upgrade is not very quick  
11:24 <vmassol> we're indeed getting very late on the release date  
11:24 <tmortagne> mflorea: the best would be to write a diff module unit test with the stings you got  
11:24 <vmassol> initially we were supposed to release on the 15th of april  
11:25 <mflorea> tmortagne, yes, I can do that  
11:25 <vmassol> we're now aiming towars the 3rd of May I think  
11:25 <vmassol> tomorrow is bank holiday in France  
11:25 <mflorea> and for (1) I can give you the /data folder I got just after upgrading the mai UI but without performing the next steps  
11:26 <vmassol> so in total that would be 3 weeks delay, I think that the most we've ever drifted… oooops :)  
11:26 <tmortagne> not sure it's good to release a final version on Friday  
11:26 <vmassol> tmortagne:  wdym?  
11:26 <tmortagne> I mean for advertisement  
11:26 <vmassol> advertising is not a problem IMO  
11:26 <vmassol> the problem is in succeeding to release something stable  
11:27 <tmortagne> anyway yes if we want to fix those two issues it's going to be short to release today especially if I'm the one fixing the two issue and releasing  
11:33 <tmortagne> mflorea: re (1) ok for the data folder if still have it  
11:33 <mflorea> yep, I'll send it to you in private  
11:35 <tmortagne> ok thanks  
11:36 <tmortagne> bb in 1h  
11:59 <vmassol> sburjan: quick question: do you sometimes test on domain-based setups?  
12:00 <vmassol> (sburjan or msmeria)  
12:00 <sburjan> vmassol: domain based setup = vincent.xwiki.org for example ?  
12:00 <vmassol> yes  
12:00 <vmassol> just curious  
12:00 <sburjan> no, I never did that. I wasn't able to setup a domain only using my local machine  
12:01 <vmassol> because I don't think we have many automated tets on that  
12:01 <vmassol> it's easy  
12:01 <sburjan> even in the old days when domain setup was the default, I used to switch to the other one  
12:01 <vmassol> you just need to modify your hosts file  
12:01 <sburjan> I'll try that  
12:01 <vmassol> hmmm so that's not very good because it means we don't know if it works or not  
12:01 <vmassol> would be interesting to find some way to test that either automated or manual  
12:01 <sburjan> well, seems to be working because xwiki.org would fail otherwise  
12:01 <vmassol> I'm asking because I'm going to make some changes to the url module  
12:02 <vmassol> yes good point, xwiki.org and myxwiki.org are good tests  
12:08 <tmortagne> yes but it's still good to test that because a lot of code has been refactored in 5.0 with the move to virtual mode only  
12:13 <tmortagne> has quit  
12:18 <Denis> vmassol: In your proposal avbout links, there are triple >, are those intended ?  
12:28 <vmassol> Denis: ah my bad then, let me check  
12:47 <mflorea> has quit  
12:51 <tdelafosse> has quit  
13:00 <vmassol> sdumitriu: ping  
13:04 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
13:25 <sdumitriu> vmassol: Pong  
13:26 <vmassol> sdumitriu: got to go, sorry but I just wanted to ask you about the platform failure  
13:26 <vmassol> I'd like to commit sometihng on platform  
13:26 <vmassol> but I'm worried that problems might not been seen with the current build failure  
13:26 <vmassol> would be great if you could either roll back or check the latest from thomasD  
13:27 <vmassol> thanks, bb in 1 hour  
14:01 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:10 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
14:32 <vmassol> back  
14:49 <sburjan> vmassol: an early alpha version of the DW doc is available.  
14:52 <vmassol> sburjan: good start!  
14:52 <vmassol> IMO it might be worth explanding a bit at the end on the 2 modes (farm vs workspaces)  
14:53 <sburjan> thanks :) I'll ping the devs to ask for their feedback, maybe they also want to put more technical information  
14:53 <sburjan> Ok, I'll do that  
14:53 <vmassol> needs platform/Features/WebHome as parent  
14:54 <sburjan> now we need to find a nice icont for http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/FeaturesExtract  
14:58 <sburjan> done, linked  
14:59 <vmassol> can you release the lock?  
15:00 <sburjan> vmassol: done  
15:01 <vmassol> cool  
15:02 <sburjan> now we need an better icon :P  
15:04 <tmortagne> I think I found what the issue is with translations  
15:04 <tmortagne> when upgrading workspaces  
15:05 <tmortagne> from what I understand the issue is that there is no translation...  
15:06 <tmortagne> there is two translation bundles in workspaces, one in xwiki-platform-workspace-ui which is installed as extension and one in xwiki-platform-workspace-template-features which is imported by workspaces when creating a wiki...  
15:06 <tmortagne> there is not much EM can do here  
15:07 <tmortagne> we need workspaces to check all subwikis at startup to make sure they have this extension  
15:07 <tmortagne> then EM will upgrade this extension in next upgrades  
15:09 <tmortagne> so to summarize, half workspaces translations are broken in subwikis, that's the translation that have been moved to xwiki-platform-workspace-template-features (XWiki.WorkspaceTranslations) when doing an upgrade from pre 5.0  
15:10 <tmortagne> unfortunately I have no idea why those translations are handled like this  
15:10 <tmortagne> creating a jira issue  
15:13 <tmortagne> XWIKI-9096  
15:13 <tmortagne> we need to decide what we do about it  
15:14 <tmortagne> even if we don't do anything the minimum is to explain in 5.0 RN migration notes that this extension need to be installed on workspaces when upgrading  
15:21 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
15:24 <msmeria> has quit

20:08 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
20:14 <sburjan\_> has joined #xwiki  
20:20 <sburjan`> has quit  
20:59 <priyanka\_> has joined #xwiki  
21:01 <priyanka\_> Hello all, I am interested in GSoc Project "LDAP server implementation" . Can anybody tell me more details about it? Actually I worked on BonitaSoft . It is also java based and use LDAP authetication.  
21:02 <priyanka\_> I want to relate BonitaSoft LDAP with xwiki. If anyon can suggest something?  
21:02 <priyanka\_> Please do reply  
21:04 <sdumitriu> priyanka\_: Hi  
21:05 <priyanka\_> hello  
21:05 <sdumitriu> So what's your experience with Bonita's LDAP implementation?  
21:07 <priyanka\_> Actually Bonita provide interface to use LDAP server. We just need to take username and password variables for bonita login page,  
21:07 <priyanka\_> it checks  entry in LDAP server  
21:07 <priyanka\_> and then provides you login  
21:07 <priyanka\_> also we can get groups of users from LDAP  
21:09 <priyanka\_> priyankacool10.wordpress.com is my blog. You can see my all posts regarding Bonita and LDAP there  
21:09 <priyanka\_> Now what does XWIKi actually need. Can you please explain?  
21:15 <priyanka\_> there?  
21:16 <sdumitriu> Hold on a bit, debugging something  
21:17 <priyanka\_> ok  
21:23 <sdumitriu> priyanka\_: OK, so XWiki already has that, it can connect to an LDAP server  
21:23 <priyanka\_> So what is LDAP server implementation in xWiki is all about?  
21:23 <sdumitriu> This project is something different: make XWiki \_be\_ an LDAP server so that other applications can use XWiki as identity server  
21:25 <priyanka\_> Ok  
21:25 <priyanka\_> Thanks Sir for your precious time.  
21:31 <sdumitriu> You're welcome  
21:33 <priyanka\_> has quit  
21:44 <priyanka3> has joined #xwiki  
21:45 <priyanka3> quit  
21:46 <sdumitriu> It's /quit
